reviews.text: This is one of 5 different Toyoko Inns at which my mom and I stayed during our recent 2-week trip. The lobby here was the largest of all of them with 3 laptops for free internet access and a local restaurant "finder" (punch one of several preset buttons and the screen displays a menu and map of a nearby restaurant). In addition to rice balls, soup, bread, and tea/coffee, the free breakfast included the egg omelet, but not juice - two items that seemed to vary from place to place.
reviews.title: Great Value Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a short ride by bus to and from Kanazawa Station, and the bus stops are very close to the hotel. We were able to walk to Kenrokuen, Kanazawa Castle and Omicho Market. Staff, as always, very polite and helpful. All in all a very nice stay.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, efficient. Welcoming staff.

reviews.text: Only had 1 night in Kanazawa, but it was well worth stopping off. I was loathe at first to book a chain hotel, preferring to stay in local, family run guest houses. However it was not easy to find these everywhere within our budget.
reviews.title: Great value, convenient to the major sites in Kanazawa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was actually a pretty nice place to stay. The staff (as we found everywhere in Japan) were just lovely. Welcoming, helpful (we have no Japanese language capability, but are good at mime). The room, as everywhere we stayed, was small but manageable. There was free internet and breakfast (traditional, i.e. miso soup, rice, and scrambled egg - bit weird when you like coco pops, but seemed standard with the Japanese).
reviews.title: great value and location. convenient and reliable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: regarding soundproofing, there was a little noise from the corridor - but as Japanese are generally MUCH more considerate than western tourists, this was very minimal.
reviews.title: Great suprising hotel!

reviews.text: If spending several weeks touring Japan it is well worth joining the Toyoko Inn member's group. There is a nominal fee for this but in no time, this has been recouped as there are discounts for weekends, and public holidays. Traditional breakfast and free internet access is included in the cost of the stay. The cost for a double room in Kanazawa was AUD110 per night. Excellent friendly service and very clean. We booked all our Toyoko Inn hotels through their website. We did the first ones prior to leaving home, then the remainder once we had stayed in some. We had a better chance of getting a vacancy by being a member. We also enjoyed these hotels because there were not large groups of international tourists staying.
reviews.title: This is an inexpensive but very well appointed hotel that is centrally located to several interesting sites.

reviews.text: This Toyoko Inn is in a great location, catch a bus from the railway station, there is a bus stop out the front to heaps of locations around the town, near the main food area and there are shops near by. The room is typical business hotel and clean.
reviews.title: Good value business hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at 3 Toyoko Inns during our 2 week vacation in Japan and this was the best out of the 3. All Toyoko Inns were clean and good value but this hotel seem quite new, bright and cheery and located in the heart of the center.
reviews.title: Great Value - Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a Toyoko Inn located closer to the train station but I think the Korinbo is better located. It is a nice, bearutiful 10-15 minutes walk to the Kenrokuen Garden and across from Daiwa Dept Store. It is located on the main strip of Kanazawa with all the high-end stores on the same street. Tons of buses stop around the hotel so it was easy to get around.
reviews.title: Really Good Value

reviews.text: Let's be honest, Toyoko Inn is a business hotel so the room is quite tiny. We had twin rooms; Japanese twin bed is bigger than the US twin bed. I would say the Japanese twin bed size is actually between the US twin and full bed. My son and I share the twin bed with no problem. It was a bit tight for my husband and I though. Each bed comes with only 1 pillow; if you want more, you have to pay for them. Same thing with towels; each twin room comes with 2 sets of towels only. The room was spotlessly clean and the bathroom is extremely tiny - space for one person only. But for the price of the hotel, I will not complain. This chain is a great value.
reviews.title: Great value, a comfortable stay

reviews.text: Title: One of the Better Toyoko Inns
reviews.title: One of The Better Toyoko Inns

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in a fair bit of Toyoko Inns across Japan. Toyoko Inn Kanazawa Kenrokuen Korinbo offers the best breakfast so far. I stayed for 3 nights and the main changed daily. First day it was scrambled egg, second day it was meat balls and third day, burger patties. Aside from that there were 2-3 types of rice (changing amongst white rice, fried rice, rice ball, porridge, ochazuke..), 3-4 types of appetisers like pickles etc, miso soup, 1-2 types of bread, coffee, and English and Green Tea. Actually there is a coffee/tea dispenser machine that offers these drinks 24/7.
reviews.title: Excellent mid range hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is also a shuttle service between the station and hotel both ways. From station in the afternoon and from hotel in the morning. Here is the link to the shuttle detail such as schedule & location at the station.
reviews.title: Great location and extras

reviews.title: Good value downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for two nights as part of a three-week trip to Japan. A friend of mine told me about the Toyoko Inn chain and I am ever so glad she did!
reviews.title: Clean, efficient, inexpensive hotel in a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, there is no beating the price. The rooms are very inexpensive. While the rates vary depending on which city you stay in, this one cost us about $70/night (6500 yen/night) for the two of us.
reviews.title: The appropriate hotel for Kanazawa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was perfect. We walked to Kenrukoen garden and Kanazawa Castle easily and there is a bus stop in front of the hotel to get to other parts of town. There was usually one person at the front desk who spoke enough English to answer any basic questions we had.
reviews.title: Best location, new, free internet in room, free breakfast

likes.liked: — A great value for money, friendly welcome, everything looks new.
likes.disliked: — Within this category of hotel, really cannot find of any negative point.

reviews.text: The rooms are very tiny, but very clean and stocked with amenities. The continental breakfast was not the best. The cold eggs and rice porridge left much to be desired. Still, I was surprised they offered breakfast at all, based on the prices.
reviews.title: Great value, Great Location
Very good value hotel
reviews.text: After splurging on a few nice ryokans, we tried to save a little elsewhere on our trip. It is hard to beat the Toyoko Inn’s prices, especially considering the cleanliness of the room and location. Usually low-cost hotels in the U.S. can be a bit dodgy, but this was not the case at Toyoko Inn (we stayed at one in Nara as well). I highly recommend this chain to anyone who wants something a little nicer than a hostel for less than $75/night.
